cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north over the northeastern Gulf of Mexico, on course for landfall in the western Florida Panhandle, then accelerating inland across AL/GA
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near Panama City–Apalachicola corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge warning Indian Pass to Yankeetown; Tropical-storm warning Navarre to Wakulla/Jefferson Co. line (Florida Panhandle)
weather_observation.warning_coast: same as watch areas above – none include Tampa Bay/Manatee County
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend; surge 1–5 ft mainly Indian Pass-Steinhatchee; heavy rain Panhandle, southeast AL, GA, western Carolinas
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (Tampa Bay south of 1-3 ft surge zone)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty showers; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely (≤34 kt probability only 4%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises possible <3 ft, mainly well north of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 1-2 inches additional rain with locally higher pockets; could trigger brief ponding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along west-central FL beaches
